alert.note: Alert for Central Tangipahoa; Northern St. Tammany; Northern Tangipahoa; St. Helena; Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 4:27PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of St. Helena, northwestern St. Tammany, northern Tangipahoa and Washington Parishes, southern Walthall, southern Pike, southeastern Amite and central Pearl River Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 427 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Crossroads to Osyka. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bogalusa, Franklinton, Poplarville, Greensburg, Amite, Amite City, Kentwood, Varnado, Roseland, Sun, Osyka, Enon, Darlington, Crossroads, Mount Herman, Wilmer, Mcneil, Gillsburg, Easleyville and Dexter. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 45 and 66. Interstate 55 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 8. Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 12 and 28, and between mile markers 30 and 31. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Tangipahoa; Northern St. Tammany; Northern Tangipahoa; St. Helena; Washington
